headline: Reuben Sandwich
description: A Reuben sandwich is easy to make with corned beef, Swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and Thousand Island dressing grilled between slices of rye bread.

video.name: How to Make a Reuben Sandwich

name: Reuben Sandwich

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a large griddle or skillet over medium heat.

Spread one side of bread slices evenly with Thousand Island dressing. On four bread slices, layer one slice Swiss cheese, 2 slices corned beef, 1/4 cup sauerkraut, and a second slice of Swiss cheese. Top with remaining bread slices, dressing-side down. Butter the top of each sandwich.
Place sandwiches, butter-side down on the preheated griddle; butter the top of each sandwich with remaining butter. Grill until both sides are golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: Crunchy and delicious
Great option for St. Patricks Day!

Nice and simple, great way to use our leftover corned beef from the night before. Imagine your life being so predictable that you could order the same sandwich everyday for 15years.. I‚Äôd love that kind of dependability ha !
So yummy.
The best sandwich I ü•™ have ever tastedüòçüòãüòãüòã
I use same ingredients, when done browning keep in pan hot dump a splash of water in pan cover steam for extra flavor
Lose the butter. Instead use THIN layer of mayo to outside of bread.

WHen Chompies has the marble bread on sale ,buy 1 get 1 free I will purchase pastrami or corned beef to make. I also drain but not rinse the sauerkraut. lay out the precut foil and assemble. Thousand or miracle whip,I use a slice of meat on both sides of bread and slice of cheese on both, another slice of meat and some sauerkraut. put together fold in the foil and freeze except for a couple days worth. Thaw the day before in fridge, usually have to take inners out and warm in microwave the grill altogether in fry pan that sandwich is buttered on both outsides.

I've made this same recipe for years. Everyone loves it including me. I just ask for the meat to be "chip-chopped" instead of slices. I like to stack it that way. I grill in my old iron skillets and sit another on top the sandwich to create a "press" no need for a fancy gadget.
I love this sandwich, the only thing is that I am not a fan of Thousand Island or Russian dressing in general , so I usually just substitute the dressing out for mayo.
Great

Definitely one of my favourite sandwiches on earth. If every ingredient is top quality, there‚Äôs nothing better out there. I have one complaint with this recipe however‚Ä¶there is no thousand island dressing on a Reuben. It‚Äôs Russian dressing. Big difference!! HAS to be Russian IMHO. Try it, I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôll agree
Came out great! I use pastrami from the deli instead of corned beef. Everyone loved it!will definitely be making this again. Huge hit.
My mouth waters every, single, time. Thank you for sharing the ingredients and instructions.
Used pastrami instead of corned beef. Turned out perfect!
I had left over corned beef and used that I stead of deli sliced and it turned out superb!! Loved it. And so very easy and better than Jason‚Äôs Deli- and that‚Äôs saying a lot!!
havent made it yet, but it sounds really good and easy to make
Very good I could only eat half of one...so filling and delicious!

This is an okay recipe for those who are looking for a starting point. Traditionally, a Ruben is made with Russian dressing and not Thousand Island. Russian is very, very easy and inexpensive to make. Secondly, as a retired executive chef from New York City, who absolutely loves Ruben‚Äôs, I advise people to use mayo and not butter on their sandwiches. All that butter does is to give you an extremely greasy sandwich, whereas, mayonnaise adds a bit of ‚Äòsavory‚Äô to the sandwich; and it's easier to spread. After-all, mayo is nothing more than egg, oil and seasonings.
It was excellent - tasty, easy to make, and a crowd pleaser.
Awesome, says it all! Thanks! :)
It was simple and easy. Tasted as good as, if not better than, McAllisters deli
Just like a deli shop sandwich. Loved it!
Followed exactly as written, and it turned out really good. We really enjoyed this recipe. Thanks for sharing.
Perfect...Just Perfect and so flavorful

I made these today. Was craving a Reuben sandwich, I haven‚Äôt had one in a while. I don‚Äôt normally use thousand Island dressing, didn‚Äôt wanna buy a big bottle to sit in the fridge so I made the recipe attached it is DELISH!! I did use a well-known brand of relish as someone had mentioned previously it makes a difference. I used Vlasic sweet relish. And cut the recipe in half as I live alone and don‚Äôt need that much dressing. I usually make all my own dressings versus buying‚Äîthis one is the bomb! Thanks for sharing!!

I heat and drain the sauerkraut and lightly saut√© the corned beef, otherwise the middle of the sandwich is cold when the bread is done. Also, with the middle ingredients preheated it only takes a couple minutes per side in a frying pan on med. high heat or 2 minutes on a Foreman or panini grill. I use more meat and seedless rye or sourdough and serve the Russian on the side as a dip.

Did I make changes?
Oh heck yeah, My family would eat me alive if I put "2" slices of corned beef in their Rueben...I mean who does that?
Minimum 1/4 lb or more!...
Other than that...awesome sammich!
Loved it!!! Just an fyi if you use mayonnaise instead of butter when you grill it, it works better. Got this hint from a chef at the Bellogio

I make a variation of this...I use cole slaw instead of sauerkraut, and I use Ken's Steakhouse Russian Dressing in lieu of Thousand Island. I prefer marbled rye, but even a good Pumpernickle is a fantastic change-up. Best cole slaw is from Popeye's. Add a side of potato salad (I use the Red Hot & Blue recipe - very important to use Hellman's mayonnaise - easy to make). Enjoy!
This recipe of the favorite savoury icon makes a simple yet elegantly classic sandwich. The pickle on the side is a must. Definitely 5 stars.
Use Pastrami.. It will alter your Reuben life !!

We had our first Reuben in the bowling alley in Omaha, NE where it originated. It was on dark rye bread with corned beef, sauerkraut and Swiss cheese, in that order, buttered on the outside and fried. There was No Thousand Island Dressing. The sandwich is delicious that way and has been ever since when I fix them.

I just wanted to share a fun fact with all of you about the Ruben Sandwich. My husband Great Great-Grandfather was the one who created the very first Ruben Sandwich in Omaha,Nebraska. We love our Ruben Sandwich with Russia dressing and Sauerkraut and Swiss cheese.

I've made these for years. It is one of my favorite sandwiches. Use good quality bread I use the butter liberally to make sure it is good & toasted. I've also put the thousand island dressing on the side to dip my sandwich.
I like to warm the cornbeef in the microwave prior to toasting the sandwith. It is easier to have a piping hot sandwich all the way through when nicely toasted.
Great! Wonderful! Thank you for having this recipe on this website.

Husband and Dad loved it. Made per recipe using George Forman grill. Smushed and soggier bread than I thought it would be, but with the butter and thousand island a lot of moisture its into the process.
Yummy.

Made this today with a couple of changes. I am a 72 year old buckaroo who was a chemist. I used Market Basket seeded Rye Bread and Market Basket Corned Beef. I heated five (5) slices of corned beef in a double boiler (adding salt to the water; boiling point elevation) until the corned beef is "crinkly". If you are not sure if it is hot enough use an instant read thermometer until it reads 160 F. Then follow the rest of the recepie.

I've made these for years. I too warm the sauerkraut slightly in the microwave. And I place it in the middle of the sandwich or else you'll have a soggy piece of toast.Over the years we've done away with the thousand island and used plain mayonnaise.

We loved this sandwich - even my hubby who doesn't care for sauerkraut asked for it again next week. We used a George Foreman grill which eliminated the 'fat sandwich flip' potential mess. Thanks so much for sharing the recipe.

I've been cooking for many decades. Never a Reuben. Until today. Goodness, it was easy, fast, and really good. I did use my cheapie Ham Beach griller at 350 degrees. I interpreted the directions as 5 min on each side, and that would have been too long, at least on the griddle. 3 min on each side. No other changes. Took maybe 10 min in total since it was my first time. This puppy is going my rotation. Many thanks!
Made it in the air fryer. Delicious, will make it again
Made this several times, used my George Foremen grill. Added horseradish to the sandwich, set temperature to 350 and grilled for 4 minutes. PERFECT!

I made this more of a club sandwich by grilling the center bread. It holds the piled high goodies. I also made thousand island dressing. The saurkraut can be a touch sweeter if you fry it first in pan with bacon grease or butter. Delicious
When cooking I stuff the brisket with pepper corns and garlic cloves. For the Rueben sandwiches I like the dressing on the side.
Can't get enough of these reubens!

Made it just as is, although a smaller quantity. The second time I made it, I shaved the corned beef, and it was easier to manage in the sandwich. And I made my own 1000 island dressing. I think it would help to heat the meat a little before making the sandwich, because the cheese melted and the bread got crisp, but the meat was not warm.
I give ajlargent's review and recipe 5 stars!
Easy recipe to follow, would recommend heating sauerkraut as suggested in many reviews. An added plus is to to make 1000 island dressing from scratch. Will make again using pastrami.
Great flavor, easy to make, family loved it!
Came out perfect! My husband said he loved it. He ate the whole thing and he usually eats 1/2 now and 1/2 later but not this time.
I made it with dark rye bread and it was so good! I will make this again. I also used Boar's Head corned beef from the local deli.

Wow easy and delicious, if not healthy sammiches. The flavors work really well together mixing the tangy dressing with the tartness of the sauerkraut, the saltiness of the corned beef, and the earthiness of the rye bread. I used homemade sauerkraut .
It was good and easy. My husband added horseradish to his sandwich and said it was good. He ate two full sandwiches. I served with soup and it made the perfect winter meal.
Easy, and very tasty. Was as good as any deli in town makes.
Followed recipe, Turned out perfectly!!!
I thought it was a really good recipe. I like more sauerkraut on mine. Lol
It was just as describe and delicious!
This sandwich was delicious!
Used homemade sourdough rye
Needed to add mustard
Oh, it was so good, stick to your ribs Good. I think even Sourdough bread would be a good mix.
Absolutely loved this sandwich!
Great recipie but if I am making a few of them I put the sauerkraut in a pot to reheat and remove moisture and use mayo instead of butter to brown the outsides.

There are many variations and combinations to be happy with for this sandwich. The one thins I will say it that not all corned beef are the same. Get some samples of different kinds from different markets/delis and fine one you LOVE!
Delicious!!! Used this as our substitute for boiled cabbage on New Year‚Äôs Day and it was a hit. Served with black-eye peas and roasted potatoes Patty Seasoning.
excellent, delicious, and easy
Really good! We add a little extra meat and only use one slice of cheese. Great with some curly fries on the side.

A good recipe, but like many others I made some changes. I pre-heated the sauerkraut and corned beef (it does not get warm enough for my taste if you just toast the sandwiches). I also at used a lot more corned beef and cheese that recommended. If you are using deli corned beef (like I did) two slices are no where near enough. I used a full pound of sliced corn beef to make four sandwiches, and two or three slices of cheese on each sandwich. They were delicious!
This recipe hit the spot with that classic reuben taste. Two slices of cheese are unnecessary though. One will do ya.
Great! Cooking over a lower heat next time and might add more cheese or a slice of tomato. 3 slices of beef may be too much without more of something else.

Something different! Something tasty! It's hard to mess this up. Used sharp swiss cheese. Didn't have the thousand island dressing, but ended up being a great dinner in just a few minutes. Enjoyed easy-peasy refrigerator pickles on the side (All Recipes' Refrigerator Dill Pickles)

Great recipe and easy. As the recipe states, it's important that you put thousand island on both pieces of bread and use 2 pieces of cheese, 1 on top and 1 on bottom. I also grill the corned beef a little before I put it on the sandwich.
Excellent recipe, but I would sub mayonnaise for the butter. More flavor.
My husband expressed it well: "Wow! This is like an orchestra of flavors in your mouth!!!" We loved it! It's now our new favorite sandwich.
Family loved it!
Delicious. Now I know how to make this at home. Thanks for the recipe.

Yes I did like the video. So thank you for posting it.unlike other people if you don't like the video just don't watch it. I followed the video as far as putting it all t.ogether. when I first ate a rueben sandwich the deli called it a Mexican rueben it had all the same ingredients this one has but it had strips of green chile that made it so delicious so that's the only thing I add to this recipe and I have the butcher slice it real thing.thank you for sharing the video and recipe
Real simple to make. I used our panini press, but next time I‚Äôm going to prepare the sandwich in a skillet.
Needed to use up some corn beef brisket and this perfect recipe did just that.

Well described directions. Especially to drain the sauerkraut so you don‚Äôt get soggy sandwiches. I used brisket that I slow braised in the oven. Sliced 1/4-in. thickness, diagonally. Served with dill pickles on the side. Thanks!
Delicious! My first ever Reuben! My husband cleaned his plate!
I used rye-pumpernickel bread instead of plain rye.
This recipe was so good! My family loved it and I will definitely make it again. It was so easy and quick to make.
My family was craving Reuben's so wanted to try and make it. The ratios in this are perfect! i added 4 slices of cheese not 4 and i found that to be perfect. will definitely make it again!!
First time making Rubens at home. It turned out great!
Great sandwich just like at the deli...

This was very good! I heated both the sauerkraut and the corned beef as some advised. Here‚Äôs a tip that works for all grilled sandwiches‚Äîinstead of butter, spread the outside of the bread with a thin layer of mayonnaise. It makes a lovely, crispy sandwich, and no one will guess you used mayo.
Good, easy recipe, but you can't possibly grill this for 15 minutes per side. You'll burn the bread! Mine was more like 3 minutes per side.
It was very good on the reuben I made but not exceptional enough for 5 stars. I would use this recipe again since it was so simple and good. My husband loved it.
Awesome! I always used Dijon in my reubens, the thousand island version is great, no more Dijon for me.

These are delicious! Even my kids ate them! I am gluten free, dairy free and allergic to eggs so for myself I substituted Schar GF Artisan Baker Multigrain Bead, Earth Balance Soy Free Buttery Sticks, Daiya Swiss Style Slices and I omitted the thousand island dressing. The result was still delicious. Thank you!
A classic Reuben. Just how I wanted it.
A family pleaser‚Äîdelicious!!

Colette G. I really enjoyed this sandwich, thank you for sharing !! Key points of Yours that need to be followed is the draining of the sauerkraut and lightly buttering the bread. Therefore you end up up with a dry grilled flavored sandwich, not a soggy one. Thank you for those reminders. No changes here, none needed. Oh, and of course add that pickle !

The ingredients are good but you need WAY MORE corned beef and cheese and sauerkraut to make this spectacular restaurant style. I used 1/3 lb of corned beef and 1/4 lb of Swiss cheese for each sandwich. also used marbles rye and pumpernickel bread. I cooked the corned beef and sauerkraut on skillet separate before making the sandwich to ensure heated all the way through. My husband was loving it.
Made it as described. Only thing I changed was I replaced the Thousand Island with ketchup. Perfect!
